name: Pam's Bierocks
author: PUSHKEMAA
summary: A German dish, these sweet dinner rolls are stuffed with ground beef, onion, and cabbage.  A great alternative to the Finnish pasty!
directions: Prepare dough: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water
Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes
Mix in sugar, margarine, egg, salt and 1/2 of the flour
Beat until smooth; add remaining flour until dough pulls together
Cover with foil and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight, OR let it rise for 1 hour
In a large heavy skillet, brown meat
Add onion, cabbage, salt and simmer 30 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C
) Coat a cookie sheet with non-stick spray
Punch down dough and divide into 20 pieces
Spread each piece of dough out on an un-floured surface and fill with approximately 2 tablespoons filling
fold dough over and seal edges
Place on prepared cookie sheet and let rise for 1 hour
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until golden brown
